Experiment Method.Assay Method: Cell culture and treatment with CMC

Material used.Description: Cells were treated with carbonyl cyanide m-chloramphenicol carboxylate (CCMC) to induce mitochondrial depolarization.

Readout description.Result Description: Mitophagy was impaired in cells expressing Parkin C289G mutant, as evidenced by reduced LC3B-II formation.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated at least three times to ensure reproducibility.

Technical replicates.Description: Not detailed in the provided text.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type Parkin was used to confirm proper mitophagy signaling.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector or non-transfected cells were used as controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Not explicitly detailed in the provided text.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal mitophagy signaling would involve proper LC3B-II formation post-CCMC treatment.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Impaired mitophagy is indicated by reduced or absent LC3B-II formation and increased levels of cytosolic LC3B-I.

Approved assay.Description: These methods are standard for studying mitochondrial dynamics and autophagy in Parkinson's disease models.

Material used.Material Source: SH-SY5Y cells transfected with Parkin mutants
Material used.Material Name: Parkin C289G mutant and HSJ1a overexpressing cells
Material used.Description: Used to assess interaction between Parkin mutants and chaperone proteins.

Readout description.Result Description: The C289G mutant showed reduced co-immunoprecipitation with HSJ1a compared to wild-type Parkin.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated multiple times for consistency.

Technical replicates.Description: Not detailed in the provided text.

Basic positive control.Description: WT Parkin interaction with chaperones was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells transfected without Parkin were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Not explicitly detailed in the provided text.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal interaction would involve significant co-IP signal compared to background.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Abnormal interaction is indicated by significantly reduced co-IP signal.

Approved assay.Description: Co-IP is a standard method for studying protein-protein interactions in cellular models of disease.

Material used.Material Name: Cells expressing LC3B-GFP or Parkin mutants
Material used.Description: Used to visualize mitochondrial depolarization and colocalization of LC3B with mitochondria.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: impaired colocalization of LC3B with mitochondria
Readout description.Result Description: The C289G mutant showed reduced colocalization of LC3B with mitochondria compared to wild-type Parkin.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated multiple times for consistency.

Technical replicates.Description: Not detailed in the provided text.

Basic positive control.Description: WT Parkin and LC3B-GFP colocalization under normal conditions was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells without Parkin or GFP were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Not explicitly detailed in the provided text.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal colocalization would involve significant overlap between LC3B-GFP and mitochondrial markers.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Abnormal colocalization is indicated by reduced or absent overlap.

Approved assay.Description: Immunofluorescence and confocal microscopy are standard techniques for studying subcellular localization in disease models.
